intro: Covellia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate covellia, is a low-growing flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically features a mat-forming growth habit with slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Covellia prostrata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
